result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon E. Felix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Theft, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**0 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Case 22CM145.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Complete a Mental Health Assessment/Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

**07/21/2022: Court orders restitution in the amount of $3,487.48 and the 10% surcharge is waived by the DA Office.

Restitution in an amount to be determined at a hearing on 07/21/2022, plus 5% and 10% surcharges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon E. Felix

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $3,487.48
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Restitution Ordered
Court orders restitution in the amount of $3,487.48 and the 10% surcharge is waived by the DA's Office.

(2:30 PM cases 22CM37, 22CM145 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon E. Felix in court, in custody. Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Brandon E. Felix.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Victims M.S. and C.C. present in court.
Parties advise there will be a stipulation to the amount of restitution in the amount $3,487.48. The District Attorney's Office is waiving the 10% surcharge fee.
Parties advise testimony will be taken regarding the defendant's ability to pay.
Attorney Van Daalwyk calls Defendant Brandon Felix who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Kirkpatrick conducts cross-examination of Defendant Felix.
Court conducts questions of Defendant Felix. Witness excused.
Attorney Van Daalwyk moves to admit Exhibit #10. No objection by Attorney Kirkpatrick. Court orders Exhibit #10 is received. 
Attorney Van Daalwyk makes argument for the Court to find the defendant is unable to pay the restitution amount stipulated to.
State makes argument for the Court to find the defendant is able to make payments towards to the restitution amount stipulated to.
Court orders restitution in the amount of $3,487.48 and the defendant will make arrangements with Probation.
Restitution hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachment

(3:20 PM cases 22CM37, 22CM145 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon E. Felix in court. Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Brandon E. Felix.
Victim M.S. present in court.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Court has a dialogue with victim M.S. regarding the offer for plea agreement the defendant may enter into today.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CM37 Count 3: Misdemeanor Theft and 22CM145 Count 1: Resisting an Officer.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CM37 Count 3 and 22CM145 Count 1.
Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation and be willing to hold a restitution hearing in the future.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. Complete a Mental Health Assessment/Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Restitution in an amount to be determined at a hearing on 07/21/2022, plus 5% and 10% surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant is ordered to have finger prints taken by June 9, 2022.
Restitution Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 2:30 pm (1 hour) in person.
Arraignment on June 2, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

9:54 AM cases called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon E. Felix appeared by phone.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Brandon E. Felix. 
Defense enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts in all matters. Both files are referred to Branch 3 to schedule a status conference. Victim/Witness statute complied with.
Dated 04/09/2022, Letter from Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk to Court requesting defendant appear by Zoom for 04/12/2022 9:30 hearing.
of M.S.
